page.title: 07WIX VILLAGE FETE.ANDREW WOOD
page.content: WIX FETE IS ORGANISED BY A COMMITTEE OF ABOUT TWENTY PEOPLE. THE PROFITS THE FETE MAKES GO TO WIX METHODIST CHURCH , ST. MARYS CHURCH AND THE VILLAGE HALL. SMALLER DONATIONS ARE ALSO GIVEN TO WIX SCHOOL AND TO WIX SPORTS AND SOCIAL CLUB. THE PROFIT LAST YEAR WAS ABOUT Â£1250. THE FIRST FETE WAS IN 1963. THE PROFIT THEN WAS Â£205 AND 3 SHILLINGS. SINCE 1967 THE FETE HAS ALWAYS BEEN HELD ON THE FIRST SATURDAY IN JUNE. THE FETE HAS ABOUT 17 DIFFERENT STALLS AND OTHER ENTERTAINMENTS ARE PUT ON DURING THE AFTERNOON. IF IT IS A NICE DAY ABOUT 2000 PEOPLE ATTEND THE FETE. CHILDREN FROM OUR SCHOOL HELP BY SELLING FETE PROGRAMMES IN GREAT OAKLEY, BRADFIELD WRABNESS AND STONES GREEN. CHILDREN FROM OUR CLASS ALSO TAKE PART IN THE 'ITS A KNOCK OUT ' COMPETITION AT THE FETE.
